channel.title: maGaming RSS Feed - thesixthaxis_com
channel.description: A cleaned-up version of the original gaming feed for thesixthaxis_com

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 22/03/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/03/22/something-for-the-weekend-22-03-25/

There’s a few of the TSA team that have jetted off to Japan in the first few months of the year, but for most of us it remains a pipe dream. But we’re blessed with countless games that look to recreate the country, whether it’s the seedy underbelly of Tokyo in the Yakuza games or patches of the country’s past. Assassin’s Creed Shadows is the latest, and it’s absolutely been worth the wait. Are you leaping into its hay bale of stabby delights this weekend?

In the News This Week

Let’s take a look at the headline news from the week.

  • Dark Outlaw Games is Sony’s new first party PlayStation studio
  • PUBG 2025 roadmap revealed, includes current console versions
  • Monaco 2 pilfers an April release date for PC, PS5 and Xbox
  • Thrasher is thumping its way to a flatscreen PC and Steam Deck release later this year
  • Croc: Legend of the Gobbos Remaster is set to launch this April
  • Sci-fi survival RPG Forever Skies fully launches April 14th
  • Empyreal looks like a stunning new indie action-RPG
  • The Knightling gets a 28th August release date
  • The Séance of Blake Manor is a spooky missing person mystery coming to Steam

Games in Review & Featured Articles

We’re at the top and the tail of the alphabet this week, but whether it’s assassins, alchemy or xenos, we’re dropping 9’s left right and centre!

  • Assassin’s Creed Shadows – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 9/10
  • Atelier Yumia: The Alchemist of Memories & the Envisioned Land – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 9/10
  • Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition – NSW – 9/10

Not only that, but we also love the handheld and headphones we’ve been using of late:

  • Retroid Pocket 5 – 9/10
  • Noble Fokus Apollo Headset – 9/10

I have a feeling that next week’s going to be a bit of a comedown from that, but we also enjoyed the other games we played this week. We’ve got an Atomfall review in progress from Gamoc, which is thoroughly endearing, if imperfect so far.

Beyond that, I dipped into a pair of early access games with Wreckfest 2 showing how this crash-happy sequel is looking to step things up over the hit original, and the action roguelike raiding of 33 Immortals has well and truly got me hooked. I’m literally going to go and play it right after finishing this round-up!

Finishing up for the week, What We Played featured Assassin’s Creed Shadows, Xenoblade Chronicles X & Atelier Yumia.

Trailer Park

FBC: Firebreak gameplay reveals a new supernatural threat: Sticky Notes

Get a deep dive into Bloober Team’s next horror game Cronos: The New Dawn

JDM: Japanese Drift Master drops a new trailer on its way to release in May

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

  • TSBonyman’s wait for Atomfall was broken by grabbing The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth, the Smash TV clone Deathrun TV, and the platforming puzzler The Last Shot. That should keep him busy this weekend, until Atomfall arrives next week.

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!
